verses.text: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;
For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: They have spoken against me \add with\add* a lying tongue.
They compassed me about also \add with\add* words of hatred; And fought against me without a cause.
For my love they are my adversaries: But I \add give myself unto\add* prayer.
And they have rewarded me evil for good, And hatred for my love.
Set thou a wicked \add man\add* over him: And let Satan stand at his right hand.
When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: And let his prayer become sin.
Let his days be few; \add And\add* let another take his office.
Let his children be fatherless, And his wife a widow.
Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: Let them seek \add their bread\add* also out of their desolate places.
Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; And let the strangers spoil his labour.
Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: Neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.
Let his posterity be cut off; \add And\add* in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the \sc Lord\sc*; And let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
Let them be before the \sc Lord\sc* continually, That he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.
Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, But persecuted the poor and needy man, That \add he\add* might even slay the broken in heart.
As he loved cursing, so let it come \add unto\add* him: As he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.
As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, So let it come into his bowels like water, And like oil into his bones.
Let it be unto him as the garment \add which\add* covereth \add him\add*, And for a girdle where\add with\add* he is girded continually.
\add Let\add* this \add be\add* the reward of mine adversaries from the \sc Lord\sc*, And of them that speak evil against my soul.
But do thou for me, O \sc God\sc* the Lord, for thy nameâ€™s sake: Because thy mercy \add is\add* good, deliver thou me.
For I \add am\add* poor and needy, And my heart is wounded within me.
I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.
My knees are weak through fasting; And my flesh faileth of fatness.
I became also a reproach unto them: \add When\add* they looked upon me they shaked their heads.
Help me, O \sc Lord\sc* my God: O save me according to thy mercy:
That they may know that this \add is\add* thy hand; \add That\add* thou, \sc Lord\sc*, hast done it.
Let them curse, but bless thou: When they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.
Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, And let them cover \add themselves with\add* their own confusion, as \add with\add* a mantle.
I will greatly praise the \sc Lord\sc* with my mouth; Yea, I will praise him among the multitude.
For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, To save \add him\add* from those that condemn his soul.
